Package com.slasherstats.controller

Class MovieController

java.lang.Object
com.slasherstats.controller.MovieController
@Controller public class MovieController extends Object
Spring MVC controller for handling user interactions related to horror movies. This controller manages movie listings, uploads, additions, deletions, updates, and searches.

  • Method Details

    • index

      @GetMapping public String index(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handles the root ("/") GET request and loads the index page with current movies, an empty movie form, and current account points.
      Parameters:
      model - the model object for passing data to the view
      Returns:
      the "index" Thymeleaf template

    • addMovie

      @PostMapping("/addMovie") public String addMovie(@Valid @ModelAttribute("movie") @Valid HorrorMovieSQL movie, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handles adding a new movie manually via form input.
      Parameters:
      movie - the movie object submitted via form
      model - the model object (not used in this method)
      Returns:
      redirect to the main movie list page

    • uploadMovies

      @PostMapping("/upload") public String uploadMovies(@RequestParam("file") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handles uploading a file containing bulk movie entries.
      Parameters:
      file - the uploaded file (CSV or TXT expected)
      model - the model object for returning errors if needed
      Returns:
      redirect to "/" on success or return "index" view on error

    • deleteMovie

      @PostMapping("/delete/{title}") public String deleteMovie(@PathVariable String title)
      Deletes a movie using its title from the path variable.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the movie to delete
      Returns:
      redirect to the main page after deletion

    • searchToDelete

      @GetMapping("/searchToDelete") public String searchToDelete(@RequestParam String title, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Searches for a movie by title and displays the delete confirmation page.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the movie to find
      model - the model object for passing movie or error data
      Returns:
      "confirmDelete" view if found, otherwise return to "index"

    • deleteConfirmed

      @PostMapping("/deleteConfirmed") public String deleteConfirmed(@RequestParam String title)
      Deletes a movie after user confirmation via form.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the movie to delete
      Returns:
      redirect to the main movie list page

    • showUpdateForm

      @GetMapping("/update") public String showUpdateForm(@RequestParam String title, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Displays the movie update form for a specific title.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the movie to update
      model - the model object for passing movie data
      Returns:
      "updateMovie" view if movie is found, otherwise return to "index"

    • updateMovie

      @PostMapping("/updateMovie") public String updateMovie(@ModelAttribute HorrorMovieSQL movie)
      Updates a movie based on form submission.
      Parameters:
      movie - the updated movie object
      Returns:
      redirect to the main movie list page

    • initBinder

      @InitBinder public void initBinder(org.springframework.web.bind.WebDataBinder binder)
      Initializes a custom data binder for web requests.

      This method registers a custom editor to handle the conversion of date strings in the format MM-DD-YYYY into Localdate objects. If the input string cannot be parsed into a valid date, the value is set to null, which allows validation annotations such as @NotNull to trigger appropriate error messages.

      Parameters:
      binder - allows customization of data binding for web requests
